description.narrative: By end of 2021, adolescent programming is strengthened and integrated in education, health, nutrition and WASH, child protection through the operationalization of adolescent programming strategy., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Behavioural change communication campaigns on gender equitable roles and practices
Capacity Development for frontline workers on gender equality
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
Technical assistance - Gender discriminatory roles and practices

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Afghanistan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2021, adolescent programming is strengthened and integrated in education, health, nutrition and WASH, child protection through the operationalization of adolescent programming strategy.

description.narrative:
A Gender strategy for the country office has been finalised as a roadmap to guide gender response programming for better results across Afghanistan priority areas of intervention. The strategy has a two pronged approach thus systematic gender integration across programme areas and a focus on key targeted gender priorities - child marriage, violence against women and girls, girls education, adolescent nutrition, menstrual hygiene management, and maternal and child health.
Through system strengthening and community engagement, C4D contributed to behaviour change at community level towards girls education, child marriage and child rearing practices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2019
